meanings.definition: Remove or take out (something) from a place.
meanings.sent1: I extracted the toy from the box.
meanings.sent3: She extracted the last cookie from the jar.
meanings.sent4: He extracted the truth from the suspect.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist carefully extracted the ancient artifact from the ground.

meanings.definition: Obtain (a substance or resource) from a material.
meanings.sent1: They extracted oil from the ground.
meanings.sent2: The company extracted copper from the ore.
meanings.sent3: He extracted the key information from the report.
meanings.sent4: She extracted valuable lessons from her mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The chef skillfully extracted flavors from the herbs for the dish.
